meanings.definition: To subject (organic matter) to high temperatures in the absence of oxygen, resulting in the decomposition of the material into volatile gases and charcoal.
meanings.sent1: Scientists pyrolize wood to study the gases it releases.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician will pyrolize the organic samples for analysis.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally pyrolized my sandwich in the microwave, and now it's all burnt!
meanings.sent4: The intense heat seemed to pyrolize the memories etched in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The volcanic eruption appeared to pyrolize everything in its path, leaving only ash behind.

meanings.sent1: The organic matter will pyrolize when exposed to extreme heat.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, we observed the substance pyrolize rapidly.
meanings.sent3: The leaves seemed to pyrolize in the scorching sun, turning brown and crispy.
meanings.sent4: As the fire raged on, we watched the wood slowly pyrolize into charcoal.
meanings.sent5: The old documents began to pyrolize in the intense heat of the fire, curling at the edges.
